Situation1: This is the last weekend before the partner relocates abroad for months.
Expectation2: Provide clients with clear and accurate legal advice
Situation2: The client’s case grows more complex and requires detailed guidance
Story: I glance at my phone, heart pounding. My partner’s message glows on the screen: “Can’t wait for our weekend. Just us.” It’s the last one before she leaves for months, and I promised her undivided attention—no work, no distractions. She deserves that. But my laptop pings with another email from a client whose case has suddenly spiraled into chaos. They’re anxious, needing clarity and reassurance, and as their advocate, I owe them my expertise and time. I feel the weight of both worlds pressing in. My partner expects me to be present, to make memories before the distance sets in. My client expects me to be thorough, to guide them through uncertainty. I stare at the clock, torn, my mind racing with guilt and worry. How can I be the boyfriend she needs and the advocate my client relies on, all at once?
